context: By 2010, Bentley Systems had grown into a comprehensive infrastructure engineering software provider with a broad portfolio of products for design, construction, and operations of infrastructure assets. The company served roads, bridges, buildings, industrial plants, utilities, and telecommunications infrastructure. Bentley continued its growth strategy through both organic development and strategic acquisitions, competing against both specialized CAD vendors and broader design software companies. The infrastructure software market was increasingly focused on BIM (Building Information Modeling) and integrated lifecycle solutions.
